title: nathan_tek
author: nathan_tek
content: I need some help. I lost the password of one of my Ethereum wallets. How can I recover my password?

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: If you still have your keys in intact you can import it on another wallet or download a new version of the wallet you are using. They will require you to create a fresh password, if you wish to. But if your keys are not with you anymore I don't know of any other means of doing recover password on wallets that doesn't require emails to create. Also don't quit yet, think deeply, you may remember your password again, unless you've not been longing into the wallet for a while.

comments.author: nick_2017
comments.body: Losing the password to an Ethereum wallet can be a challenging situation. Here are a few steps you can take to attempt password recovery:Use any password recovery options provided: Some wallet services or software may offer password recovery options like security questions, email verification, or backup phrases. Check if such options are available and follow the instructions provided.Check for wallet backup: If you have previously made a backup of your wallet, you may be able to restore it using the backup file or seed phrase. Look for any wallet backup files or written-down recovery phrases and use them to restore your wallet.Seek professional assistance: If the above options do not work, it's advisable to seek professional assistance from the wallet provider or a knowledgeable cryptocurrency expert. They may have specialized tools or techniques to help recover access to your wallet.Accept the possibility of permanent loss: Unfortunately, if you are unable to recover your password and do not have any backups or recovery options available, it's possible that you may permanently lose access to the funds in that wallet. This serves as a reminder to always keep backups and securely store recovery phrases for your wallets.Remember, cryptocurrency wallets prioritize security, so password recovery processes are intentionally difficult to prevent unauthorized access. It's crucial to take preventive measures by regularly backing up your wallets and keeping your passwords secure and easily recoverable.

comments.author: nathan_tek
comments.body: Quote from: nick_2017 on July 09, 2023, 05:40:08 PMLosing the password to an Ethereum wallet can be a challenging situation. Here are a few steps you can take to attempt password recovery:Use any password recovery options provided: Some wallet services or software may offer password recovery options like security questions, email verification, or backup phrases. Check if such options are available and follow the instructions provided.Check for wallet backup: If you have previously made a backup of your wallet, you may be able to restore it using the backup file or seed phrase. Look for any wallet backup files or written-down recovery phrases and use them to restore your wallet.Seek professional assistance: If the above options do not work, it's advisable to seek professional assistance from the wallet provider or a knowledgeable cryptocurrency expert. They may have specialized tools or techniques to help recover access to your wallet.Accept the possibility of permanent loss: Unfortunately, if you are unable to recover your password and do not have any backups or recovery options available, it's possible that you may permanently lose access to the funds in that wallet. This serves as a reminder to always keep backups and securely store recovery phrases for your wallets.Remember, cryptocurrency wallets prioritize security, so password recovery processes are intentionally difficult to prevent unauthorized access. It's crucial to take preventive measures by regularly backing up your wallets and keeping your passwords secure and easily recoverable.I only have the keystore file. I have lost the password of them. I don't have any seeds.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Quote from: nathan_tek on July 09, 2023, 06:50:16 PMI only have the keystore file. I have lost the password of them. I don't have any seeds. If you completely lost your password and had no backup, the only way to access your current funds is to brute force the keystore file. There is no other way around.I suggest you consider two options, a simple or hard way.The simple one is to hire services such as Wallet Recovery Services(https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=240779.0). That is assuming your wallet contains a significant amount or you bother to spend some fees. The hard one is to manually use a password cracker application that is suited to the Ethereum Keystore file. Both of them require you to remember some information regarding the password. For example, to approximately recall the password characteristics, such as, does it consist of upper case, lower case, number, symbol, etc. and how much of the length?

comments.author: disconnectme
comments.body: Quote from: nathan_tek on July 09, 2023, 05:15:36 PMI need some help. I lost the password of one of my Ethereum wallets. How can I recover my password?You need to look for it, some people will come here asking about wallet password, do you think if this is a public knowledge that most of the big wallet would have been drained. there is a reason why they called it password and private keys, it should be private, I just pray that you would be able to remember the password or else your fund is locked forever

comments.author: |MINER|
comments.body: Quote from: nathan_tek on July 09, 2023, 05:15:36 PMI need some help. I lost the password of one of my Ethereum wallets. How can I recover my password?I don't really understand what it means that you have lost your ethereum wallet password. Have you somehow removed your Ethereum wallet app? If you do this and you don't have backup the recovery phrases of that wallet then it will not possible to get back or recover your wallet. Just remember if there are recovery phrases somewhere. And if it doesn't stay then you give up hope of getting your wallet back. And so that this mistake does not happen in the future, always backup the private key or recovery phrases in advance.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: nathan_tek on July 09, 2023, 06:50:16 PMI only have the keystore file. I have lost the password of them. I don't have any seeds. There are several cracking tools for json file passwords , i am not familiar with the best ones, but you can just google "ethereum wallet recovery password" or something similar and choose a github link that looks legit. You can also use google to see who has linked to that github if you can't read the code and want that legit sources have confirmed it.However it isn't guaranteed to crack it. If you have chosen complex enough password it's nearly impossible to crack. But if you remember maybe part of it can use it in your advantage.

comments.author: SlimShadyMmp
comments.body: If you have seed phrase then its easy to backup or recover the wallet If no then I think you are screwed mate Its important you keep your seed phrases and private keys secured For password its just that Metamask cant remember your pass so I will suggest simple one and keep seed and private keys stored safe and incase of emergencies like this one

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: If you don't have the recovery phrases or private key of that wallet then there's no other way to get access on that wallet. If you can't also remember the password of it, the only way of getting on it is to keep on remembering the usual passwords that you've been using. Some might say that through bruteforce but it's still unlikely. However, checkout the recovery service but be careful out there as there could be scammers pretend that they can do it for you.

comments.author: nathan_tek
comments.body: Thanks for all your suggestions. Probably it's impossible to get the password back, because it was a complex phrase.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Quote from: nathan_tek on July 10, 2023, 03:06:54 PMThanks for all your suggestions. Probably it's impossible to get the password back, because it was a complex phrase. That is devastatingly unfortunate. It is a pity that you enforcing a strong and secure password yet on the other hand you didn't keep up with a backup plan. Certainly, passwords that contain a set of complex characteristics might extremely unlikely to be brute forced or cracked.I do really hope the lost amount is worth the experiences you might receive. A direct distressing experience might help you to force to learn more deeply about how properly safely and securely store a private key, it is essential not to repeat the same mistakes.

comments.author: TheSpiral
comments.body: Quote from: nathan_tek on July 10, 2023, 03:06:54 PMThanks for all your suggestions. Probably it's impossible to get the password back, because it was a complex phrase. feeling sorry for you. how much fund was there in the wallet? have you checked your capslock? sometimes capslock turned on when we entering the password which change our words to capital or probability of turning on when you create new password. kindly do every possible search to find passwords. I pray for you to get it. However it is also lesson to backup complex password in save place to use it in the future this kind of situation.

comments.author: TastyChillySauce00
comments.body: Quote from: nathan_tek on July 10, 2023, 03:06:54 PMThanks for all your suggestions. Probably it's impossible to get the password back, because it was a complex phrase. The only way to recover your wallet through privatekey. You can do that if you have one. Have you ever used your wallet in metamask? If you have ever used it and then you can try to reveal the private key of your wallet through metamask. This will help you to sign in your wallet again without password. There's no way to know what's your password. that's why you shall always try to take private key as a back up once you lose your password.

comments.author: ahoenk
comments.body: Try bruteforce it. I dont think people will forgot his password and not remember even a clue. Try to use your daily password. Or ia the wallet ypu found it somewhere ? Then you must bruteforced it.

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: nathan_tek on July 10, 2023, 03:06:54 PMThanks for all your suggestions. Probably it's impossible to get the password back, because it was a complex phrase. That might be so, but just don't throw the file away and lose all hope, you might get it open in the future as computers get more powerful and most likely password crackers as well.This of course doesn't comfort you any time soon and it might take more than a lifetime to get there depending on various things. We even might have quantum computing sooner than later. Cryptos will adapt but those old kind of passwords are going to be obsolete.

comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: If your password is something generic like password, noname etc, you might get lucky and regain access by bruteforce but chances are high that this will remain locked if bruteforce can't work, unless you can find or remember the password you used here, goodluck in cracking your password.Quote from: nathan_tek on July 10, 2023, 03:06:54 PMThanks for all your suggestions. Probably it's impossible to get the password back, because it was a complex phrase. Don't give up just yet , any chances your wrote it somewhere or maybe you reused a password from other platform's...you never know ow just keep trying..

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: nathan_tek on July 10, 2023, 03:06:54 PMThanks for all your suggestions. Probably it's impossible to get the password back, because it was a complex phrase. As long as you know some words that are in it,I think it can be cracked with enough hash power used to crack passwords.I had one blockchain wallet lost from 2014 and I thought to have 10.000 dollars there so I asked Dave here from Wallet Recovery Services and only gave him about 5 letters from a 34 letter password.Unbelievable but true he managed to find out my super complex password which again unfortunately I had confused that wallet with another one and had 0 money in it.The fee for him is 20% if he is successful and he is trusted here,at least he was up until 1 year ago when he stunned me with his performance.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: nathan_tek on July 09, 2023, 05:15:36 PMI need some help. I lost the password of one of my Ethereum wallets. How can I recover my password?I supposed its a meta mask wallet you are ok losing your password as long as you have your private keys pr passphrase all wallets are private key and passphrase based as long as you have it you can access your coins which is why in times of creation you are advised to keep your private keys or passphrase to a safe location you don't have to remember but keep it where you are the only that can access it.Now if you don't have these three, password, private keys, and passphrase I'm afraid that you're coins are gone if it's a huge amount you can get the services of wallet recovery but there's no guarantee that you can recover it.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Quote from: ahoenk on July 10, 2023, 08:24:50 PMTry bruteforce it. I dont think people will forgot his password and not remember even a clue. Try to use your daily password. Or ia the wallet ypu found it somewhere ? Then you must bruteforced it. That's possible that someone will forget his passwords even if they're just normal combinations of numbers and letters. But the solution to this is to force himself to remember anything that could be his password. No one can help him on this one but just to brute force it with any password that he might have using. Because if there's no way for him to remember any password that he have used to this wallet, no help will arrive on him. He may have a clue if he tries to remember it but then, just keep on trying or just give it up.
